result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexa B. Salmela

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexa B. Salmela in court.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Alexa B. Salmela.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; statement made. Offer just received, adjourned for 30 days. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *AMENDED 8/19/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH A.K.S. dob 3-12-2007 OR S.K.W. dob 9-16-1981. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. NO CONTACT WITH VICTIMS' RESIDENCE REMAINS IN EFFECT.*

Defendant Alexa B. Salmela in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ashley Renz for Jacob Hilton for defendant. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Victim makes statement. Bond amended to no violent contact with victims, no contact with residence remains. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 8/19/2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH A.K.S. dob 3-12-2007 OR S.K.W. dob 9-16-1981. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. NO CONTACT WITH VICTIMS' RESIDENCE REMAINS IN EFFECT.*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.K.S. dob 3-12-2007, S.K.W. dob 9-16-1981 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Alexa B Salmela in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Victims are present and make statement. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
